meanings.definition: To put together or compose from materials gathered from several sources.
meanings.sent1: I will compile all the research data into a report for the meeting.
meanings.sent2: She likes to compile her favorite recipes in a cookbook.
meanings.sent3: It was amusing to compile a list of all the strange things found in the lost and found box.
meanings.sent4: Her mind seemed to compile memories like a well-organized library.
meanings.sent5: The detective had to compile all the evidence to solve the case.

meanings.definition: To collect and arrange in a systematic form.
meanings.sent1: The librarian will compile the books on the shelf by genre.
meanings.sent2: He likes to compile his notes in a neat binder for easy reference.
meanings.sent3: It was amusing to compile a list of excuses for being late to class.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts seemed to compile neatly like a stack of papers.
meanings.sent5: The artist had to compile all the colors to create a beautiful painting.

meanings.definition: To create a computer program by translating a high-level programming language into machine language.
meanings.sent1: The software engineer will compile the code to create the new application.
meanings.sent2: Programmers compile their code to check for errors before running it.
meanings.sent3: It was amusing to compile a program that only responded in rhymes.
meanings.sent4: The code seemed to compile into a masterpiece of functionality.
meanings.sent5: The student had to compile the program step by step to understand its logic.
